column4: hello, sat here in dread looking at another kernel update :-( All previous ones got into a loop about merging changes (menu.lst?) and left the computer unbootable. I then had to do a usb boot to fix. Don't know if I have the patience for another round.
I normally just pick the option for the package maintainers version and haven't had any problems
Does that option leave the previous kernel?
I've found that it add's the previous kernel's into the menu.list with the newest one at the top
ok, good to know, thanks
btw, are you dual booting?
its set up for dual boot, although i don't boot into the other O/S very often
ok. Now holding my breath while it updates... I may faint... especially if it's problem free :-)
Good luck
no fainting here. Exactly the same boot problem "Error 17: Cannot mount selected partition"
Sounds strange, I've not seen error 17 before
it's reported often. The boot menu line has no root device specified. Now if only could remember, "root (hd0,6)/..."
Just picked up a point that error 17 is reported if the partition requested exists, but the filesystem type cannot be recognized by GRUB.
yep, because of the missing entry for root device
Maybe you should report it as a bug if you find it happens everytime you get a kernel update
I will but I'm pretty sure it has been reported many time already
luckily I have unetbootin also on the hd
Good job you're used to it and expect it, at least you know what to do to fix it
yeah, but I'm PO at having to go through the same pain every time
relief, back up running, wifi not effected... my be my lucky-ish day :-)
FYI (and others) a kernel update puts "root ()/ubuntu/disks" in every option in menu.lst instead of, in my case, "root (hd0,5)"
